titles.title: Love Kome: We Love Rice Nikisaku
ラブ米 -WE LOVE RICE- 二期作
Love Rice 2
爱米 -WE LOVE RICE- 第二季

anime.description: "The Harvest Show" is a concert where all of the different grains show off their beauty to everyone watching, and "HarveStars" is the name given to the grains who put on the best performances. In this age of rice acreage reduction policies and Westernization of eating habits, bread has become the most popular grain in Japan, and tables are dominated by "Yeast King," the bread HarveStars. But five new rice students have enrolled at Kokuritsu Inaho Academy, a school on the verge of shutting down, and they form a new group called "Love Rice" that`s practicing to beat Yeast King... Source: crunchyroll

tag.name: idol
tag.description: In Japanese culture, idols (アイドル) are media personalities in their teens and early twenties who are considered particularly cute and cuddly and who will, for a period ranging from several months to a few years, regularly appear in the mass media, e.g. as singers for J-pop groups, bit-part actors, TV personalities, models in photo spreads published in magazines, advertisements, etc. Source: wiki

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: elements
tag.description: Next to Themes setting the backdrop for the protagonists in anime, there are the more detailed plot Elements that centre on character interactions: "What do characters do to each other or what is done to them?". Is it violent Action, an awe-inspiring Adventure in a foreign place, the gripping life of a Detective, a slapstick Comedy, an Ecchi Harem anime, a SciFi epic, or some Fantasy travelling adventure?

tag.name: music
tag.description: Music anime generally revolves around people concerned with music in their everyday lives. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competitions, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal. This is not unlike the Sports category.

tag.name: new
tag.description: Not based on anything, the story is a new work, usually made up by the people involved in creating the anime. Generally if an original work (原作) credit is given, it will be to the studio, or director, or other members of the production team.

tag.name: anthropomorphism
tag.description: Anthropomorphism is the attribution of uniquely human characteristics to non-human beings, inanimate objects, or natural or supernatural phenomena. If it`s an animal or an object (AI excluded) and it speaks and/or does other human-like things (dresses up) then we`re dealing with anthropomorphism. Anthropomorphism leans more on the animal-looking side when compared to http://anidb.net/t7 [juujin], which leans more on the human-looking side.

tag.name: school life
tag.description: Since a large part of the anime audience still takes part in school life or is visiting college, it is only natural to choose a setting the audience can identify with, be it elementary, middle, or high school. For the older viewers a college setting with more mature real-life problems is appropriate. And since clubs take up so much time in the lives of students, these are obviously also important.

tag.name: the arts
tag.description: The arts represent an outlet of human expression, usually influenced by culture, and driven by human creative impulse. Major constituents of the arts include literature – including poetry, novels and short stories, and epics; performing arts – among them music, dance, and theatre; culinary arts such as baking, chocolatiering, and winemaking; media arts like photography and film, and visual arts – including drawing, painting, and sculpting. Some art forms combine a visual element with performance (e.g. film) and the written word (e.g. comics). From prehistoric cave paintings to modern day films, art serves as a vessel for storytelling and conveying mankind`s relationship with its environment. Source: Wiki

tag.name: short episodes
tag.description: Short episodes are regular episodes that are much shorter than the standard length. This means up to and including 10 minutes; shows with episodes that are 11 to 20 minutes in length are http://anidb.net/t6494 [half-length episodes] instead. Not to be confused with http://anidb.net/t6349 [multi-segment episodes], which are regular episodes that are split into several short segments (parts), usually with separate titles and independent storylines.

tag.name: technical aspects
tag.description: It may sometimes be useful to know about technical aspects of a show, such as information about its broadcasting or censorship. Such information can be found here.

episode.title: 幻の6人米[シックスライス]
The Legendary Six Rice Boys (Mixed Rice)
Maboroshi no Six Rice
episode.summary: After receiving the phone call, the gang rushes to Hinohikari`s side to find him burnt to a crisp. It seems he`s fallen ill from pushing himself too hard because the next event for the busy and popular Love Rice is drawing near... and he`s been told that he has no chance of performing. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: スクールハーベスター・ラブライス
School Harvestar Love Rice
School Harvestar: Love Rice
episode.summary: Morinokuma-san and Koro-nee are getting married. The usual gang is in the audience at the reception, but Hinohikari is nowhere to be found. A comment from Morinokuma-san`s students and a Harvest Show by Koshihikari bring the celebration to joyful new heights, until Morinokuma-san gets a phone call... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 当初のコンセプトだとラブ米は一応女子向け
Based on the Original Concept, Love Rice Is Really Meant to Be Aimed at Girls
Tousho no Concept Da to Love Kome wa Ichiou Joshi Muke
episode.summary: Hinohikari had suddenly collapsed in the classroom, worrying the other members of Love Rice. Then, after school, the door bursts open, and a new first-year named Oidemai suddenly puts on a Harvest Show. How will this passionate fan of Love Rice fit into the story? Meanwhile Yeast King, the bread HarveStar unit, is eating out with Love Rice when the waitress asks if they`d prefer bread or rice with their meals. And glaring through the window at their conversation from outside is Sho... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新しいライバルは麺
Our New Rival Is Noodles
Atarashii Rival wa Men
episode.summary: Love Rice started a rice riot at the Harvest Festival and became a sensation overnight. They`ve been super busy with TV appearances, rice planting, and other activities, but the group`s leader, Hinohikari, is acting strange... Meanwhile, a new exchange student arrives at Inaho Academy, and he`s a ramen HarveStar named Sho. The members of Love Rice can`t help feeling flustered by the appearance of a new rival. What will come of the peace that had settled between the grains? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 怒られろラブライス!!
Love Rice Needs a Scolding!!
Ikararero Love Rice!!
episode.summary: One morning, as Nikomaru is getting ready for school, Akitakomachi shows up at his door carrying a lost baby named Rinx Kobayashi. Akitakomachi says he found the baby in a rice cooker on his way to school. The two of them decide to take care of Rinx Kobayashi together, and through much trial and error, they try their hardest to be good parents. Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 踊り! 炊き走査線 The Movie
Riceside Shakedown: The Movie
Odori! Taki Sousasen: The Movie
episode.summary: Love Rice is in a celebratory mood after their victory in the uel and the return of Hinohikari. Then Koshihikari arrives, and he seems troubled. It turns out he`s decided to make a movie starring Sasanishiki! Hinohikari, Hitomebore, Akitakomachi, and Nikomaru are all on board, but Sasanishiki is less thrilled. Will they be able to complete the filming? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 穀☆物☆王
The Grain King
Koku Mono Ou
episode.summary: Ramen`s popularity has skyrocketed at Inaho Academy ever since Sho`s "Mendependence Day" Harvest Show at OniSummer. Two weeks have passed since Hinohikari disappeared, leaving the other Love Rice members worried. Then both Sho and Koshihikari appear in front of them, and Koshihikari suggests that the two HarveStars settle their conflict with an "uel"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 弱虫ライス
Weakling Rice
Yowamushi Rice
episode.summary: It`s the day of OniSummer. Oidemai successfully fills in for the ailing Hinohikari, and the "new Love Rice" is able to put on its Harvest Show. Then everything suddenly goes dark, and Sho comes flying into the venue on a giant noodle bowl. Everyone is stunned as Sho launches into his Harvest Show, "Mendependence Day"... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: ゲームへの浪漫飛行
Romantic Flight Toward the Game
Game e no Roman Hikou
episode.summary: Hinohikari`s continuous cropping damage and Oidemai`s disappearance weren`t orchestrated by Sho; it was all the work of Non-carb, an enemy so overwhelmingly powerful that he wiped out Koshihikari. Love Rice attempts to fight back with a rice shower... but can they ever hope to defeat Non-carb? The battle to protect the peace between rice, bread, and noodles reaches its conclusion! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 偽ショウの正体は炭水化物抜きダイエット
The Fake Sho Is Really a Carbohydrate-Free Diet
Nise Shou no Shoutai wa Tansuikabutsu Nuki Diet
episode.summary: Love Rice and CaKing are bewildered when two Shos stand before them. But one of the two is actually Non-carb, who`s trying to impose a carbohydrate-free diet on the world. His attacks have been aimed to make all the grains fight each other, eventually wiping themselves out. Indeed, the grains begin to disappear one after another to the beams Non-carb emits. Finally, he stands face-to-face with Love Rice... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それゆけ! ケーキング
Go Forth, CaKing!
Sore Yuke! Caking
episode.summary: Students from Inaho Academy and St. Pan High School are disappearing one after another, and now the gang can`t even get in touch with Oidemai or Rinx Kobayashi. Then the concerned members of Love Rice are confronted by Sho, who`s acting very strange. As Sho launches his attack, the next to appear before them is... Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 米の名は.
Your Rice Name.
Kome no Na wa.
episode.summary: One night, Chinkobozu and Manamuzume are gazing at a shining comet as it streaks across the night sky. Then they go to sleep... and awaken to find that they`ve switched bodies? They`re forced to remain in that state while Manamusume goes to kindergarten and Chinkobozu takes the stage for a live performance. How will these two very different people overcome this crisis? Source: crunchyroll
